definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: Their veto was tantamount to terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 他說這五個國家手中的否決權就等同於恐怖主義。

sentences.english: Well, he has veto power, which can be very powerful.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，總統有否決權，這一點是非常厲害的。

sentences.english: On the ninth I signed legislation granting the President a line-item veto.
sentences.chinese: 9日，我簽署法令，准予美國總統擁有單項否決權。

sentences.english: China and Russia, both of which have veto power in the Security Council, object to the resolution.
sentences.chinese: 在安理會擁有否決權的中國和俄羅斯都反對這項決議。

sentences.english: The Council Would Work Better Without the Veto.
sentences.chinese: 沒有否決權，安理會的工作會更好。

sentences.english: The president used the power of veto.
sentences.chinese: 總統行使了他的否決權。

sentences.english: And where national vetoes are eroded, there is the European Parliament.
sentences.chinese: 哪裏有國家的否決權被侵蝕，哪裏就有歐洲議會。

sentences.english: The President threatened to use his veto over the bill.
sentences.chinese: 總統威脅要對這個議案行使否決權。

sentences.english: Russia is one of the council’s five veto-holding, permanent members.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯是擁有否決權的五個安理會常任理事國之一。

definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
the right to be elected/the right to stand for election
to look favorably on sth/would be glad to see it happen
